Case reference: 2014005841.CaseDesc: Alfred Sassin has not been seen since he left his home in downtown Vancouver on July 9, 2012. Mr. Sassin's absence was reported to police by the resident caretakers on July 16, as they had not seen him for over a week, which was unusual for him.

Case reference: 2014004814.CaseDesc: Stephanie Stewart was employed as a Fire Spotter at the Athabasca Lookout near Hinton, Alberta when she disappeared on August 26, 2006. She was 70 years old at the time of her disappearance. Stephanie led an active lifestyle and was in good health. Her disappearance is being treated as suspicious. The police investigation is ongoing.

Case reference: 2014004050.CaseDesc: On Saturday, June 25, 1994, Stephen Tudor was participating in a one man (solo) sailboat race from Port Huron to Mackinac Island.  The sailboat he was sailing, the "ANERIRIN" was located abandoned along the Goderich, Ontario shoreline. Police were unable to locate any signs of Mr. Tudor.

Case reference: 2014001540.CaseDesc: Marie Laliberté was a resident of east Vancouver who was engaged in a high risk lifestyle. She was last seen by her resource worker on January 1, 1997. Due to her increasingly sporadic contact with family and a lack of social interaction with others, she was not reported missing until March 8, 2002.

Case reference: 2005004999.CaseDesc: On June 26, 1995, the body of an unidentified man was found in the lower part of the Niagara River. The man suffered from gynecomastia; a condition that enlarged his breasts.

Case reference: 2020007348.CaseDesc: On April 25, 1971, Liliam Alvarado was seen for the last time as she left her hotel room in Toronto, Ontario. Liliam left the hotel without her belongings.

Case reference: 2014005110.CaseDesc: On June 3, 2008, at approximately 9:25 p.m., Jaquelyn Latto was seen for the last time as she left the Juliette Place Shelter in Toronto, Ontario. Jaquelyn had told the staff at the shelter that she was going out with her brother.

Case reference: 2014043144.CaseDesc: On August 3, 2014, Aaron Dragonetti was seen for the last time in the downtown area of St. John’s Newfoundland.

Case reference: 2015066565.CaseDesc: George Wood was last seen in Surrey BC, on June 20, 2015 by family. At the time George Wood was reported missing, he was unemployed and of no fixed address living on the streets in Burnaby BC. His absence and not keeping in touch with family is out of character.

Belt: Black, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Black belt with large silver buckle
Scar: Right Arm, Long scar on right arm

Case reference: 2014006619.CaseDesc: On November 5, 2008, Colo Flannel was seen for the last time as he left the Intervalle Centre in the Longue-Pointe District in Montreal, Quebec. Colo suffers from a paranoid personality disorder, and may have possibly returned to Haiti.

Case reference: 2014002878.CaseDesc: On February 26, 2001, Albert Fare was seen for the last time as he left his residence in Niagara Falls, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Albert was despondent.

Scar: Neck, Surgical; back of the neck

Case reference: 2008004899.CaseDesc: Fernand Martin, also known as Fernand Boutin, last seen on the 24th April, 1964 when he visited the outpost at the north end of the Pakashkan Lake.  He was tending to his traplines in the bush near Pakashkan Lake.

Jacket: Animal Skin, light doe skin jacket
Shirt: size 33 shirt with a 15.5 inch neck

Case reference: 2012020113.CaseDesc: On September 11, 2004, Sylvie Menard was reported missing in Trois-Rivières, Quebec. Sylvie was last seen at approximately 1:00 p.m. in a licensed establishment located at the intersection of 3rd Row and Highway 359 (Main Street) in Saint-Luc-de-Vincennes, Quebec.

Case reference: 2012020144.CaseDesc: This body was recovered from the Esquimalt Lagoon.

Teeth: Braces, Upper jaw intact and shows clear evidence of dental work (metal fillings).

Case reference: 2006023299.CaseDesc: Edward Nelson was last seen on June 21, 1987, in South Bay on Lake Nipigon. He was on a fishing boat heading southwest to go fishing and failed to return.

Case reference: 2014005192.CaseDesc: In the late afternoon of May 12, 1980, Adjutor Lapointe was seen for the last time leaving his residence in his vehicle in Chicoutimi, Quebec. During this time, he was accompanied by an acquaintance.

Case reference: 2014003990.CaseDesc: On November 28, 1978, Yashar Ilkay and his wife went to bed for the night. When Yashar’s wife woke up in the morning, her husband was no longer in the residence. He left his residence without his glasses, dentures and money. Mr. Ilkay was last seen in Moncton downtown area.

Shirt: brown, white and blue long sleeve shirt

Case reference: 2014003839.CaseDesc: On October 20, 1988, George Leslie was seen for the last time at his residence in the city of St. Catharines, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, George was despondent. His vehicle was subsequently located abandoned in a parking lot in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2020049381.CaseDesc: On November 6, 2020 Sean Hart was last seen leaving Seven Oaks Receiving Home in Victoria, British Columbia.  Sean has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014001538.CaseDesc: During the month of March, 1998, Theresa Johnny was seen for the last time in Whitehorse, Yukon. The last known contact with Theresa was on July 18, 1998, with the Anchorage Police Department in Alaska, United States. Over the years, there have been a number of unconfirmed tips received about Theresa’s location and well being.

Case reference: 2016047824.CaseDesc: On August 18, 2016, Marie-Claude Hebert was last seen leaving her residence, on foot, on St-Calixte Street in Plessisville, Quebec. She has not been seen since.

Sweater: Cotton, Black, Unknown logo on the front

Case reference: 2019013046.CaseDesc: In August 2018, Celia Maria Da Silva was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014006177.CaseDesc: On October 9, 1987, at approximately 9:00 p.m. Phillip Orvis went out onto the lake in his boat from Matheson Island. He was planning to go to his fishing camp at Black Bear Island. At the time that he left the water on the lake was very rough. Phillip could not swim and he was known to never wear a life jacket. His boat was found the next day drifted up against the mainland approximately 1/2 mile south east of the dock where he is believed to have left from. The boat was filled with water. Searches were conducted by land, air and water and dragging operations were conducted on the lake however his body was never located. Phillip Orvis is presumed dead due to drowning and foul play is not suspected.

Case reference: 2013000133.CaseDesc: On July 14, 2013, Prince Edward OPP (Picton) were advised of a 30 ft sailboat that had run aground on the shores at Point Petre (Lake Ontario). It was determined that the sailboat was from Rochester, New York and had left the Chimney Bluff State Park Marina (New York) on July 13,  2013 in the morning. Based on GPS tracks the investigators suspect that Scott French went overboard in American waters, and the boat drifted into Canadian Waters.

Hair: Brown, Brush Cut, Balding at the front
Shoes: Leather, White, New Balance, Running shoe

Case reference: 2013000024.CaseDesc: Susan Dawson was living with, and working for, Terry Murphy for approximately 3 weeks prior to her disappearance. She was last seen in the late hours of November 12, 1985 at a gathering at Terry's house. On November 13, a blue car was seen in Terry's yard. On November 14, at approximately 11:55 a.m., a massive explosion occurred at Terry's residence. Terry's remains were found in the debris but there was no indication that Susan was in the house at the time of the explosion. Investigators suspect foul play, and that Terry had some involvement with Susan's disappearance.

Case reference: 2018041446.CaseDesc: On April 20, 1998, Richard Opato was last known to be in the region of Niagara Falls, Ontario at approximately 5:30 p.m. There has been no news of his whereabouts or well being since this time.

Hair: Brown, Short, Other, Losing hair on the top of his head

Case reference: 2014002651.CaseDesc: Mabel Leo was last seen leaving a party near Nairn Falls, Pemberton, BC, in 1969, and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014001875.CaseDesc: On May 25th, 1987 at approximately 9:00 a.m., Rene Parr left his home in Trois-Rivieres, Quebec, where he was living with his sister for the previous 6 months. He was in the process of a divorce and he was scheduled to attend the courthouse the next day. Rene has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014005935.CaseDesc: On December 4, 2012, Lucien Bélanger left his residence near the Saint-François River in Drummondville, Quebec. He had made suicidal comments and was despondent at the time of the events.

Case reference: 2018015227.CaseDesc: On March 22, 2018, at approximately 1:00pm, Maria Ruiz Zein was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Maria boarded a flight to go to Colombia, but has not returned to Canada.

Case reference: 2012020015.CaseDesc: Veronica Lem was reported missing on June 11, 2009 from Richmond, BC. She missed a flight from the Vancouver International Airport to Toronto, Ontario. Miss Lem may suffer from mental health issues.

Case reference: 2014004678.CaseDesc: On January 23, 1996, at approximately 4:30pm, Isaac and Sara Floresquintana were last seen at their mother’s home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014041668.CaseDesc: Lise Fredette was last seen leaving work in the city of Peterborough on the evening of November 12, 2014. Subsequent investigation has led to the arrest and conviction of a male in regards to the disappearance of Mrs. Fredette, however her remains have yet to be located.

Case reference: 2006009799.CaseDesc: On May 25, 1974, Francis Foster, Robert Warren and another friend departed for a canoe trip on Basswood Lake, Quetico Park, 45 miles (72 km) south of Atikokan, Ontario. It is believed that the canoe overturned and all three are presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2016068704.CaseDesc: On June 7, 1966, a female was recovered from the water near Amherstburg. Death is believed to have occurred within a few hours to a couple of days prior to recovery.

Teeth: Other, She wore upper and lower complete dentures.
Other: American .25 cent piece in the pocket and a key pinned to the right side of her dress.
Shoes: black cloth with white rubber soles; size 6.5
Dress: Black, pullover with floral pattern, matching belt and a white button
Scar: Left Chest, 7.5 cm semicircular scar on her upper left breast
Left Upper Arm, 2 cm vaccination scar
Front Of Neck, 8 cm thyroidectomy scar
Mark: Right Eye, 2 x 0.8 cm xanthelasma on her right lower eyelid

Case reference: 2014002222.CaseDesc: On September 9, 1958, at approximately 9:15 a.m., Cindy-Lou McLane was last seen playing outside of her residence in Willow River, British Columbia. There is a strong possibility that Cindy-Lou may have been abducted.

Case reference: 2014004043.CaseDesc: On March 8, 2002, Eva Nakanjako, her husband Robert Mukwaya, and their son Emmanuel Mukwaya were last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Eva and Robert had not shown for work for three weeks and had not paid their rent. During the time of their disappearance, their apartment was found partially emptied.

Case reference: 2014004707.CaseDesc: On June 17, 1986, Paul Leduc was going to the family cottage at Lake Duhamel in the Saint Jovite, Mont Tremblant area. He has not been seen since. His vehicle and personal belongings were found at the cottage. His canoe containing paddles and a life jacket was found adrift on the lake near the cottage.

Case reference: 2014004675.CaseDesc: Jean-Louis Bourgeault was last seen on September 12, 2005 in Montreal. Mr. Bourgeault left the Suzanne Blanchard Pavillon, a mental health resource linked to the Louis Hippolyte Lafontaine Hospital. Mr. Bourgeault was homeless in downtown Montreal prior to entering the Pavillon.

Case reference: 2009004699.CaseDesc: On September 14, 1994, Kenneth Blais, 27 years of age, had an argument with his mother. He left his residence on Levesque Street, Sturgeon Falls, Ontario, saying he was going to meet up with his father. The family assumed that Kenneth went to the Ottawa region. Kenneth never met up with his father and is still missing.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, Cross done by hand

Case reference: 2014004367.CaseDesc: Kendall Sumner has gone away in the past without notifying anyone, however for him to be away this long is completely out of character.

Case reference: 2020008537.CaseDesc: On February 12, 1991, Tharshini Tharmalingam was last seen by her brother at their school in Toronto, Ontario. Thashini had told her brother she would meet him at home, but she never arrived.

Case reference: 2016003652.CaseDesc: Shelley Desrochers was last seen on January 2, 2016 in London (ON). Police and family are concerned for her well being.

Other:
Cell Phone, Lost cell phone 
BLACK ZTE GRAND X2 Z850
S# 867239025096526 & SS 326E52104380
Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, Rose, Heart & blue bird

Case reference: 2019065945.CaseDesc: On November 13, 2019, at approximately 7:00 p.m., Shane Kowerko was seen for the last time as he left a friend’s residence in Winnipeg, Manitoba. Shane did not tell his friend where he was going, and left his winter jacket there.

Tattoo: Right Forearm, Girl holding baseball bat
Right Side Of Neck, Jiminy Cricket
Right Forearm, Chinese writing 5 characters (woman, word, name)

Case reference: 2014001057.CaseDesc: On October 10, 1989, the body of a man, possibly originating from Romania was discovered in a skylight of a condominium building. According to experts the man had bodily injuries resulting from a very high fall.

Socks: Wool, Beige, for left foot only
Pants: Wool, Brown, Black, size 30; made in Poland

Case reference: 2012020114.CaseDesc: Sebastien Metivier went missing in Montreal on November 1, 1984. The young boy was in front of the Tres-Saint-Nom-de-Jesus church on the east side of the city. He was heading to an arts and crafts course.

Pants: Blue, Patch on the right knee

Case reference: 2022000648.CaseDesc: Murray Marsden went missing from Calgary, Alberta, sometime between April 29, 2010, and December 28, 2021.

Scar: Left Eye, Scar located in left eyebrow
Deformity: Left Hand, Left hand fingers are flexed

Case reference: 2018007092.CaseDesc: On February 8, 2018, at approximately 4:15pm, Wenting Liu was seen for the last time at Yorkdale Mall in Toronto, Ontario. Wenting was visiting Canada and failed to board her returning flight on February 10.

Coat: Pink, Puffy with fur hood and knee length

Case reference: 2014005162.CaseDesc: Steve Messervie was seen for the last time on October 6, 2008 in Montreal.  Mr. Messervie had been in hospital, however his identity had not been confirmed through identification documents.  Mr. Messervie had been diagnosed as having amnesia prior to leaving the hospital.

Case reference: 2014001506.CaseDesc: During the early morning hours of February 24, 1991, Harrison Brown left a friend's home on snowmobile and was last seen traveling near open water.

Hat: Plastic, Black, Snowmobile helmet with red and gold stripes
Scar: Left Upper Arm, Just above elbow

Case reference: 2014005491.CaseDesc: On August 9, 2010, Michael Blakney was seen for the last time on a forest trail in the Scoudouc area of New Brunswick.

Deformity: Left Leg, Walks with a limp

Case reference: 2014005583.CaseDesc: Mary Mark was a resident of east Vancouver in the 1970's. She did not apply for any government-issued identification or obtain social assistance, so information is very sparse on Mrs. Mark's life after 1975. It is believed that she met with foul play as the result of domestic violence. Her body was never recovered and the suspect is now deceased.

Case reference: 2006023499.CaseDesc: Viola Panacheese was last seen on August 18, 1991 walking on Lakeshore Avenue in Sioux Lookout, Ontario.  Ms. Panacheese wears glasses but was not wearing them at the time of her disappearance.

Scar: Right Shin, burn scar from knee to ankle

Case reference: 2006019399.CaseDesc: Randall Gunning was last seen on May 5, 1984, in the area of Elliot Lake. Mr. Gunning suffered from depression and was despondent when he left.

Case reference: 2014003102.CaseDesc: On July 31, 1972, David Kyak was seen for the last time in Iqaluit, Nunavut.

Hat: Canvas, Blue, Ball cap, Polar bear crest

Case reference: 2014003136.CaseDesc: Linda Christian Pedersen was last seen at 9:15 a.m. on June 3, 1981 when she left her boyfriend's apartment in Victoria.  She reportedly returned to her own apartment before 11:30 a.m. and spoke to a male acquaintance.  Her whereabouts since that time are unknown.  Linda left behind all valuables and medication.  She was to have met a girlfriend at 4:30 p.m. but failed to show up for the meeting.  She was interested in theatre production and was reportedly meeting an actor during the evening of June 3, 1981.

Hat: Other, Frequently wore a dark-coloured beret

Case reference: 2014002504.CaseDesc: On August 19, 1982, friends reported Michael Roshko missing to police. At the time Michael had not been seen in over a week and friends had become concerned. Police located Michael's camp and found his personal belongings still there. Mr. Roshko has not been located and his whereabouts are unknown.

Case reference: 2014043636.CaseDesc: The partial skull of an adult male was found in October 2013 near the "Papa Woods" mountain bike trail near Prince George, British Columbia. It is believed he died several years before his remains were discovered.

Case reference: 1987203340.CaseDesc: Joanne Pedersen went missing on February 19, 1983, near her home at Vedder Crossing (Chilliwack). She was last seen with an adult male at a telephone booth.

Case reference: 2014003678.CaseDesc: On June 21, 1960, Donald McKillop's wife reported him missing to the Police. The last time she spoke to her husband was on June 19. She was working away from the home and returned on the June 20 to find her husband away.   Mr. McKillop's wife indicated to police she had spoken to her husband and he had not indicated he was leaving for any reason. Donald McKillop left the home without his wallet, there was no clothing missing and all his carpentry tools were present. Inquiries with family and friends revealed nothing else. Mr. McKillop had no history of mental disorder or suicidal tendencies.  There is no indication of foul play in his disappearance.

Case reference: 2015011639.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1986, the body of an adult male believed to be between the ages of 30-40, was found in the waters of Pier 2 of the La Ronde marina on St. Helen’s Island in Montreal, Quebec.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Teething is natural with dentistry work. He could have had two partial dentures.
Sweater: White, Blue, T-shirt with blue sleeves

Case reference: 2013000103.CaseDesc: On September 20, 1969,  three commercial fishermen sold their catch, purchased groceries and departed Jackpine Island for Brochet via Reindeer Lake. Mr. Bighetty left in his own canoe and was ahead of two other men who were also travelling by canoe. The second canoe later had mechanical problems and had to stop on an island. The two men indicated that they had heard the other canoe and figured it was Mr. Bighetty coming back to look for them. However, they never saw him again. Mr. Bighetty's canoe was located in the lake in a vertical position 9.6 kilometers south of Brochet. It is presumed he drowned and no foul play is suspected in this matter.

Case reference: 2014002760.CaseDesc: On June 3, 1976, a witness saw Claude Houle fall from the Laviolette Bridge in Trois-Rivières, Quebec. His body was never recovered.

Case reference: 2010004099.CaseDesc: Timmy Villemaire was last seen by his family in the Cambridge area sometime in 2001. At the time of his disappearance, he was showing signs that he may have been suffering from schizophrenia. He was queried by a Waterloo Regional police officer in Cambridge on June 1, 2002. Normal checks on his health card, SIN card and more cards have shown no activity since the time of his disappearance.

Hair: Brown, Short, Curly, Beard, moustache, sideburns

Case reference: 2012020031.CaseDesc: Michael Feist's fully operational car was found abandoned near Cherhill, Alberta.  Mr. Feist is known to have well-developed survival skills. Police investigations regarding Mr. Feist's whereabouts are currently ongoing.

Case reference: 2012020063.CaseDesc: On June 18, 1966, Kimberley Mclean was seen for the last time in Whiteshell Provincial Park in Rennie, Manitoba. That day, Kimberley and her mother had attended Camp Alloway for a staff picnic.  Upon their arrival, Kimberley changed into her bathing suit and went to the dock area. Five minutes later, Kimberley's mother went down to the dock with some cookies for her daughter, but was unable to find her.

Case reference: 2014004920.CaseDesc: On May 1, 2004 William "Bruce" Molaski left his residence in Toronto, Ontario, in a maroon pick-up truck. A few days later, police found Mr. Molaski's truck at 16 Regatta Road in Toronto.

Case reference: 2012020148.CaseDesc: This adult male was recovered from English Bay in Vancouver

Pants: Grey, Green, With a frog logo
Shoes: Leather, White, Grey, Made in Italy

Case reference: 2016068946.CaseDesc: On July 23, 1972, the body of a male was found washed up on the shore of the Municipal Beach, in St. Catharines. It is believed that he had been in the water for only a few hours prior to discovery.

Case reference: 2009004199.CaseDesc: Manou Sokpor was reported missing to police by his fiancée. She had last spoken with Manou at 2:00 a.m. on May 14th, 2009 by telephone; nothing seemed out of the ordinary. His fiancée had no further contact with Manou the rest of that day which was out of his character. On May 15th the vehicle Manou usually drove was located in his driveway, and his wallet and cellular phone were in the bedroom.

Teeth: Visible Missing, First or second molar upper left jaw, gap in front teeth.

Case reference: 2012020082.CaseDesc: Katelyn Noble was last seen in the Radisson, SK district in mid August, 2007. Katelyn has had no contact with her family or friends in Mission, BC, and her whereabouts are unknown.

Case reference: 2014004393.CaseDesc: Jean Garnek lived in an apartment block in the McGregor area of the city, where she was known to walk wherever she needed to go. She was also known to use the Winnipeg Transit System.

Case reference: 2018063001.CaseDesc: On March 10, 1995, at around midnight, Ying Zhu was last seen by her boyfriend when he dropped her off at her home in Toronto, Ontario. The following day, her boyfriend arrived at Ying’s work to pick her up and found out that she had quit her job the previous week.

Case reference: 2014002414.CaseDesc: On August 13, 1983, Michael Milavanov and his father were canoeing on Kingsmere Lake near Waskesiu, SK. The canoe tipped over in rough water. His father survived however searches failed to locate Michael Milavanov.

Case reference: 2014002875.CaseDesc: Edmond Belliveau was last seen on Oct 1, 1985, in Saint John, NB.

Case reference: 2016058794.CaseDesc: Raymond Raine was reported missing in 2016 after family members had not heard from him in several years. Raymond has ties to Maskwacis, Alberta, but was last known to be in the Fort Saskatchewan, Alberta area.

Case reference: 2018041855.CaseDesc: On December 8, 1992, Grayce Baxter was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. She was a known transgendered sex trade worker. She had a transaction with Patrick Johnson who subsequently confessed to her homicide. Grayce’s remains were never recovered.

Coat: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Fur, Full length coat

Case reference: 2016068410.CaseDesc: On September 10, 1966, the body of a Caucasian male was recovered from the Grand River in Onondaga Township, Brant County. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 170lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. This individual consumed a large meal of corn shortly before his death. He was uncircumcised. It is estimated that he died in the latter half of August or early in September 1966.

Teeth: Many of his teeth were missing and some of the remaining teeth showed evidence of dental work.
Scar: Right Abdomen, Old, well healed 2" appendectomy scar running obliquely

Case reference: 2014002167.CaseDesc: On July 7th, 1973, Mr. Gorrie and his family were seen returning from a day of fishing on Cross Lake by the local RCMP patrol. Mr. Gorrie followed the patrol boat for some time and eventually the family boarded the patrol boat while Mr. Gorrie continued to follow in his boat. Both vessels proceeded west however after a time, the height of the waves increased (7 to 8 ft.). As a result the patrol boat had to increase power, which substantially increased the distance between the respective boats. Mr. Gorrie's boat was last seen a 1/2 mile behind the patrol. Immediate searches by air provided negative results. It is presumed that Mr. Gorrie drowned as he or the boat have never been located.

Case reference: 2005005699.CaseDesc: On June 22, 1991, the body of an unidentified man was recovered from the Niagara River between Horseshoe Falls and the "Maid of the Mist" boat docks. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 113 lbs, however this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He had signs of having suffered an acute or chronic right lung infection. He is estimated to have been dead for several months. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts this unidentified male is either of European ancestry, or South Asian ancestry, or mixed European and South Asian ancestry.

Teeth: Several amalgam fillings in his teeth and multiple posterior teeth in his upper and lower jaw were lost/removed prior to death.

Case reference: 2005003199.CaseDesc: On July 11, 1990, an unidentified man was found near the Hydro Plant in the Niagara River. He had short fingernails with dirt embedded underneath them and callouses on his hands. His appendix was present and he was uncircumcised.

Hair: Black, Shorter than collar length with dark bushy eyebrows
Scar: Left Index Finger, old scar at the base of the finger
Mark: Left Side Of Neck, small mole

Case reference: 2019040153.CaseDesc: On July 4, 2019, Shae-Lynn McAllister was seen for the last time at 10:30 pm leaving work at the A&W restaurant in Fairview, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014001849.CaseDesc: On August 14, 1974, Murphy Williams was last seen working in a labour camp located between Fort St. John and Dawson Creek in British Columbia. It was reported that Mr. Williams was exhibiting signs of distress and it is believed that he may have attempted to walk from the labour camp to Fort St. John.

Case reference: 2021056970.CaseDesc: On November 12, 1998, the remains of an unidentified woman were recovered from North West Connoire in Newfoundland. The woman had a complete fusion of the proximal and intermediate phalanges of her right ring finger. This fusion would have rendered her joint completely immobilized.

Case reference: 2019003520.CaseDesc: On January 14, 2019, Addrienne McRobert was seen for the last time leaving the residence of a friend in Oshawa, Ontario.

Coat: Black, Hooded, "BENCH" written vertically on the back
Tattoo: Left Thigh, Text: Forever & Always & Derek

Case reference: 2014005938.CaseDesc: In December 2010, Mashia Rezadoust was seen for the last time by her father in Toronto, Ontario. Mashia was taken to China by her mother, but has never returned.

Case reference: 2014043999.CaseDesc: The partial cranium belonging to an adult male was found in 2013 in a wooded area north of Terrace, British Columbia. It is likely he was of Asian or Indigenous descent and appears to have sustained a significant facial injury in his lifetime. It is believed he was deceased for several years prior to his cranium being recovered.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Nose, Possible healed fracture of nose - Maxilla

Case reference: 2014005770.CaseDesc: On August 29, 1979, Thomas Lidguerre and Lawrence Sanger headed out from Fond du Lac to Uranium City on Lake Athabaska. The boat was located two days later, swamped near the Narrows and Popular Point. A search was conducted and lasted for over one month without any success in locating M. Lidguerre and M. Sanger.

Case reference: 2013000043.CaseDesc: On September 4, 2010, Jonathan Jette and Rachael Bagnall went hiking in a mountainous region north of Pemberton, B.C. They intended to spend 2 to 3 days climbing some peaks in the area. They failed to return and were reported missing. Their vehicle was located however despite an extensive search, no other trace of them has been found.

Sweater: Wool, Brown, White, zip up sweater (Hudson's Bay type)
Luggage: Light Green, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, 4 person tent

Case reference: 2010001199.CaseDesc: Michael Hinsperger was in a canoe on Carson Lake, Barry's Bay, at 3:00 P.M. on May 13th 2010. The canoe was recovered but Mr. Hinsperger has not been located.

Jacket: Black, Yellow lettering "Harley Davidson Owners club"

Case reference: 2006025099.CaseDesc: On July 10, 1988, a Caucasian male, believed to be between the ages of 40-74, was recovered from the Otonabee River, south of Lock 19 in Peterborough. There were stains on his teeth, which suggests that he was a smoker. The remains could have been in the water for a few weeks to many years.

Teeth: Stained, Although he was missing most of his molars, his upper left third molar was carious and could have caused him significant pain.

Case reference: 2014003295.CaseDesc: Wayne Ronald Baker was reported missing on June 8, 1989 after not reporting to his shift at Phil's Restaurant in Banff, Alberta.  He was last seen by his roommate in staff accommodation the evening of June 7. Wayne Baker may have been seen in Edmonton at the Crest Hotel in July 1989.

Case reference: 2000000183.CaseDesc: Matthew was last seen at a truck stop in Sicamous in British Columbia, Canada.

Case reference: 2014003143.CaseDesc: On August 16, 1978, Diane Jaspersen, native of Calgary, Alberta, was last seen in Hope, British-Columbia. She was hitch hiking with her dog "Jack" on the highway leading towards Vancouver Island. Diane was headed to a friend's  cabin  where she was supposed to be staying and attend a festival, but never made it.

Case reference: 2012030001.CaseDesc: In April 2011, both parents took their son, Aleksander to visit the mother's family in Poland. The father came back to Canada on his own on May 13, 2011. The mother, Elzbieta Nowacki and child did not return to Canada.

Case reference: 2018010996.CaseDesc: On February 25, 2018, at approximately 11:00pm, Ilya Platonov was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Ilya did not attend school the next morning.

Case reference: 2008004499.CaseDesc: Paul Lanteigne was last seen on July 19, 1990. He telephoned his wife on July 20 to advise her he was leaving Cranberry Marina at 6:00 p.m. to return to the Dyconia Hotel in Wasaga Beach in his boat. The boat was recovered overturned in Georgian Bay, and a search was conducted. Grey deck shoes belonging to Mr. Lanteigne were found on the beach on July 21, 1990, but nothing else was recovered.

Case reference: 2014004511.CaseDesc: On July 29, 2004 George Davis left a residence near Creston, BC to get cigarettes. He was driving a 1981 brown Chrysler Lebaron with a British Columbia licence plate. The vehicle has not been recovered.

Mark: Eyes, Mole lower lid right eye

Case reference: 2020007628.CaseDesc: On August 16, 1971, at approximately 8:30pm, Stephanie Rawlinson was last seen near 2801 Jane Street in Toronto, Ontario. Stephanie had left her home in a cab after getting into a disagreement.

Mark: Right Eye, Mole near right eye

Case reference: 2014003880.CaseDesc: Yvon Robitaille was last seen on the evening of April 1, 1996, as he was travelling on 3rd Avenue in Val-d'Or. He has not been seen since.
